warning.linux: If you have never used Pybricks with USB on Linux, you will need to configure udev rules to allow permission before you can flash the hub firmware.
warning.windows: If you have never used Pybricks with USB on Windows, you may need to manually install a USB driver before you can flash the hub firmware.

instruction: To flash the firmware, the hub must be placed in bootloader mode. {startPoweredOff}, then follow the instructions below:

startPoweredOff.default: Start with the hub powered off
startPoweredOff.usb: Start with the hub powered off and the USB cable disconnected

step.disconnectIo: Disconnect all motors and sensors from the I/O ports on the hub.
step.holdButton: Press and hold the {button} on the hub.
step.waitForLight: Keep holding the {button} and wait for the {light} to start flashing {lightPattern}. This takes about 5 seconds.
